page.title: 07"Bowcombe"-Rowridge.
page.content: The transmitting station and 450 foot mast at{Rowridge}were built in 1954 to transmit all the BBC's FM radio and TV programmes, the Independent channels being susequently broadcast from the nearbye Chillerton Down transmitter. Two years ago, however, Rowridge took over all ITV programmes as well. The station gets its signals from the Post Office Tower via British Telecom, but if the signal breaks down then it is relayed from the BBC's Crystal Palace transmitter via intermediate stations. {Originally the station was manned {round the clock by twelve engineers on {a shift system. Today the station is {largely automated and is manned in {normal working hours by three {engineers and a part time secretary.}
